Package service

Class ServiceSqlImpl

java.lang.Object
service.AbstractServiceSql
service.ServiceSqlImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
ServiceSql
public class ServiceSqlImpl extends AbstractServiceSql
Concrete implementation of AbstractServiceSql that validates and executes SQL queries using the application's configured JPA and Hibernate infrastructure.

Provides dialect detection by introspecting the underlying Hibernate SessionFactoryImplementor, and executes test queries using JDBC connections managed by JpaAccessHolder.

Intended as a singleton; use getInstance() to access the shared instance.

Author:
Felix Seggeb√§ing

    • testExecuteQuery

      protected void testExecuteQuery(String sql) throws SQLException
      Executes the given SQL query using a JDBC connection obtained from JpaAccessHolder.

      Used internally to validate or test the provided SQL query.

      Specified by:
      testExecuteQuery in class AbstractServiceSql
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL query to execute
      Throws:
      SQLException - if an error occurs during query execution

    • getDialect

      public String getDialect()
      Returns the SQL dialect currently used by the underlying Hibernate SessionFactory.

      This method attempts to unwrap the Hibernate Session from the current EntityManager, retrieve the SessionFactoryImplementor, and extract the dialect information via getJdbcServices().getDialect(). The result is the fully qualified class name of the Hibernate dialect in use (e.g., org.hibernate.dialect.PostgreSQLDialect).

      If Hibernate is not present, the dialect cannot be determined, or any exception occurs during extraction, this method returns "UNKNOWN".

      Returns:
      the Hibernate SQL dialect class name, or "UNKNOWN" if unavailable
